member.name: T:Serenity.Web.ImpersonatingAuthorizationService
member.summary: Adds impersonation support to any IAuthorizationService implementation

member.name: T:Serenity.Web.LogicOperatorPermissionService
member.summary: Adds AND OR operator support to any IPermissionService implementation
member.remarks:
Register this class in your application start, to allow | & operators in your permission services, e.g.
registrar.RegisterInstance<IPermissionService>(new LogicOperatorPermissionService(new MyPermissionService()))

member.name: T:Serenity.Web.TransientGrantingPermissionService
member.summary: Adds temporary granting support to any IPermissionService implementation
member.remarks:
Register this class in your application start, to allow granting permissions temporarily.
registrar.RegisterInstance<IPermissionService>(new TransientGrantingPermissionService(new MyPermissionService()))

member.name: M:Serenity.Web.TransientGrantingPermissionService.Grant(System.String[])
member.summary: Grants specified permissions temporarily (or makes it look like)

member.name: M:Serenity.Web.TransientGrantingPermissionService.GrantAll
member.summary: Grants all permissions temporarily (or makes it look like)

member.name: M:Serenity.Web.TransientGrantingPermissionService.UndoGrant
member.summary: Undoes last grant or grant all operation

member.name: T:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode
member.summary: Thumbnail scaling modes

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.StretchToFit
member.summary: In this mode, thumbnail is generated just at the size requested. If thumbnail width or height specified only, than thumbnail will have same aspect ratio, otherwise if thumbnail and source is not at same ratio, thumbnail will have a narrowed or widened look.

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.PreserveRatioNoFill
member.summary: Try to keep original aspect ratio of source image while generating the thumbnail. If only width or height is set, it works same way with StretchToFit. When both set, thumbnail width or height will be decreased suitably.

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.PreserveRatioWithFill
member.summary: It is logically same with PreserveRatioNoFill but this time instead of decreasing thumbnail width or height, empty parts are filled.

member.name: F:Serenity.Web.ImageScaleMode.CropSourceImage
member.summary: In this mode only central part of source image (horizontally or vertically) is taken to keep thumbnail at requested size if aspect ratio of source image is different.

member.name: T:Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalCache
member.summary: An abstraction for local cache access (e.g. System.Web.Cache). The 'local' means objects in local memory, so no serialization should be in effect.

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Adds a value to cache with a given key
member.param: Expire time (Use TimeSpan.Zero to hold value with no expiration)

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalCache.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the value with specified key from the local cache.

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalCache.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the value with specified key from the local cache. If the value doesn't exist, no error is raised.

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalCache.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all items from the cache (avoid expect unit tests).

member.name: T:Serenity.Abstractions.IDistributedCache
member.summary: An abstraction for distributed cache access. (e.g.: Redis, MemCached, Couchbase)

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.IDistributedCache.Increment(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments value with specified key and returns the new value. If value doesn't exist, its new value will be 1.
member.returns: Increased amount, or 1 if it didn't exist before

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.IDistributedCache.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the value with given key. If value didn't exist in cache, return the default(T) value.
member.remarks: It may raise an exception if the value is not of type TValue.

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.IDistributedCache.Set``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Writes the value to cache with specified key.

member.name: M:Serenity.Abstractions.IDistributedCache.Set``1(System.String,``0,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes the value to cache with specified key and expiration date.
member.param: The time the cached item will be expired on.

member.param: True to hide field on update

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.VisibleAttribute
member.summary: Controls visibility of a column / form field.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.AlignRightAttribute
member.summary: Right aligns text horizontally (usually in a grid column)
member.remarks: Used for text alignment in grids by adding `align-center` CSS class to corresponding SlickGrid column. Note that it has no effect on editors or forms.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.AlignmentAttribute
member.summary: Controls horizontal alignment of text (usually in grid columns).
member.remarks: This is an abstract base class. You need to use AlignCenter or AlignRight attributes.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.AlignCenterAttribute
member.summary: Centers text horizontally (usually in a grid column).
member.remarks: Used for text alignment in grids by adding `align-center` CSS class to corresponding SlickGrid column. Note that it has no effect on editors or forms.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.DisplayFormatAttribute
member.summary:
Sets the display format for a column. This has no effect on editors! It is only for Display, "NOT Editing". For editing, you have to change UI culture.
Display format strings are specific to column data and formatter type.
If column is a Date or DateTime column, its default formatter accepts custom DateTime format strings like "dd/MM/yyyy". We don't suggest setting DisplayFormat for dates explicitly, use UI culture setting in Web.config unless a column has to display date/time in a different order than the default. You may also use following standard format strings:
- "d": "dd/MM/yyyy" where DMY order changes based on current UI culture.
- "g": "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm" where DMY order changes based on current UI culture.
- "G": "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss" where DMY order changes based on current UI culture.
- "s": "yyydd-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss" ISO sortable date time format.
- "u": "yyydd-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ" ISO 8601 UTC.
If column is an integer, double or decimal it accepts.NET custom numeric format strings like "#,##0.00", "0.#"

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute
member.summary: Placed on rows / or custom lookup classes to denote it has a lookup script.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LookupScriptAttribute.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Defines that this type has an external lookup script type, and the lookup key is available on that type. Use this overload only for row types that have external lookups.
member.param: Script type with LookupScript attribute of its own.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.Key
member.summary: Lookup key, usually in "Module.EntityName" format.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.Permission
member.summary: Permission key required to access this lookup script. Use special value "?" for all logged-in users. Use special value "*" for anyone including not logged-in users.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.Expiration
member.summary: Cache duration in seconds

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupScriptAttribute.LookupType
member.summary: External lookup script type or base type that should be used for generating dynamic lookup script. Only meaningfull for Row types with external lookup scripts. Can be a generic type of TRow or a simple lookup class.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.AllowNonImage
member.summary: Should non-image uploads be allowed.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.MaxSize
member.summary: Maximum size in bytes of the uploaded file.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.MinSize
member.summary: Minimum size in bytes of the uploaded file.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum height in pixels of the uploaded image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.MaxWidth
member.summary: Maximum width in pixels of the uploaded image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.MinHeight
member.summary: Minimum height in pixels of the uploaded image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.MinWidth
member.summary: Minimum width in pixels of the uploaded image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.ScaleWidth
member.summary: What width image should be scaled to. Default value of 0 disables it.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.ScaleHeight
member.summary: What height image should be scaled to. Default value of 0 disables it.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.ScaleSmaller
member.summary: Should image be scaled up to requested size when its smaller

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.ScaleMode
member.summary: What kind of image scaling should be used to generate image.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.ThumbSizes
member.summary: List of thumbnail sizes requested. Something like "96x96;128x128;200x200"

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.ThumbMode
member.summary: What kind of image scaling should be used to generate thumbnails.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.JsonEncodeValue
member.summary: Only useful for MultipleImageUploadeEditor. Specifies wheter to JSON encode value. If your field is a string field set it to true.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.OriginalNameProperty
member.summary: If you want to store original name of the file uploaded, set this to the name of another string field. Only used for single image uploads.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.DisplayFileName
member.summary: If you have no original name property but use original name in file name with {4} format parameter, set this to true to force ImageUploadEditor show file name.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.CopyToHistory
member.summary: Should a copy of file placed in a special history folder on upload. This helps preserving old files on update.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.FilenameFormat
member.summary: Format of the file name like "ProductImage/{1:00000}/{0:00000000}_{2}". Parameter 0 is the row identity value, 1 is identity value / 1000, and 2 is a random string like 2cxs4bc. You can also use the shortcut "ProductImage/~" which is equivalent to the prior sample. If you don't specify this, it will default to something like Product/ProductImage/~ which is generated by combining row class name and field name.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.DisableDefaultBehavior
member.summary: If you don't want ImageUploadBehavior to process this upload, and want to handle it manually, set to true (not recommended)

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.ImageUploadEditorAttribute.SubFolder
member.summary: Avoid. For compability with older versions. This part of filename is used as a prefix to FilenameFormat, but it is not stored in database.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.InsertableAttribute
member.summary: Controls if this field is editable in new record mode. When used with fields, turns on or off the insertable flag.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.InsertableAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls if this field is editable in new record mode. When used with fields, turns on or off the insertable flag.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.UpdatableAttribute
member.summary: Controls if this field is editable in update record mode. When used with fields, turns on or off the updatable flag.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.UpdatableAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls if this field is editable in update record mode. When used with fields, turns on or off the updatable flag.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.CssClassAttribute
member.summary: Sets the CSS class for columns and form fields. In forms, class is added to container div with .field class that contains both label and editor. For columns, it sets cssClass property of SlickColumn, which adds this class to slick cells for all rows. Slick column headers are not affected by this attribute, use HeaderCssClass for that.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.LookupKey
member.summary: Lookup key, e.g. Northwind.CustomerCity

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.InplaceAdd
member.summary: Enable inplace add / edit functionality

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.InplaceAddPermission
member.summary: Permission required to use inplace add / edit

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.DialogType
member.summary: This property is meaningfull when InplaceAdd is true. By default, dialog type name is determined by LookupKey, e.g. if lookup key is "Northwind.CustomerCity", a dialog class named "Northwind.CustomerCityDialog" is used. If dialog type is different than lookup key, set this to classname, e.g. "MyModule.MyDialog"

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.CascadeFrom
member.summary: ID (can be relative) of the editor that this editor will cascade from, e.g. Country

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.CascadeField
member.summary: Cascade filtering field (items will be filtered on this key, e.g. CountryID) Make sure you have [LookupInclude] attribute on this field of lookup row, otherwise you'll have empty results as this field won't be available client side.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.CascadeValue
member.summary: Cascade filtering value, usually set by CascadeFrom editor, e.g. the integer value of CountryID If null or empty, and CascadeField is set, all items are filtered

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.FilterField
member.summary: Optional filtering field (items will be filtered on this key, e.g. GroupID) Make sure you have [LookupInclude] attribute on this field of lookup row, otherwise you'll have empty results as this field won't be available client side.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.FilterValue
member.summary: Optional filtering value, e.g. the integer value of GroupID. If null or empty string no filtering occurs.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.MinimumResultsForSearch
member.summary: The minimum number of results that must be initially (after opening the dropdown for the first time) populated in order to keep the search field. This is useful for cases where local data is used with just a few results, in which case the search box is not very useful and wastes screen space. The option can be set to a negative value to permanently hide the search field.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.Multiple
member.summary: Allow multiple selection. Make sure your field is a List. You may also set CommaSeparated to use a string field.

member.name: P:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorBaseAttribute.Delimited
member.summary: Use comma separated string instead of an array to serialize values.

member.name: M:Serenity.ComponentModel.LookupEditorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: If you use this constructor, lookupKey will be determined by [LookupScript] attribute on specified lookup type. If this is a row type, make sure it has [LookupScript] attribute on it.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.IgnoreAttribute
member.summary: Skips a property while generating grid column or form field list. Use this to ignore a property for UI, but still use it for other purposes like JSON serialization. This might be useful when a type is used as a Service Request and Form Declaration at the same time.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.HintAttribute
member.summary: Sets a hint for a form field. Hint is shown when field label is hovered. This has no effect on columns.

member.name: T:Serenity.ComponentModel.PlaceholderAttribute
member.summary: Sets a placeholder for a form field. Placeholder text is shown inside the editor when its value is empty. Only editors using basic inputs and Select2 editor supports this.

member.name: T:Serenity.IO.GlobFilter
member.summary: A fast glob implementation, compatible with .gitignore patterns of GIT

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.GlobFilter.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a new GlobFilter, containing both include and exclude patterns. When "include" is null / empty, all files are included by default, unless they match a pattern in "exclude" list. When "exclude" is null, it is ignored.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.GlobFilter.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a new GlobFilter, with just "include" globs.

member.summary: Force delete

member.summary: Try to delete

member.name: F:Serenity.IO.DeleteType.TryDeleteOrMark
member.summary: Try to delete and mark if can't delete

member.name: T:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper
member.summary: Contains helper functions for temporary files and folders

member.name: F:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper.DefaultTemporaryCheckFile
member.summary: A signature file that marks a folder as a temporary file to ensure that it actually contains temporary files and can be safely cleaned

member.name: F:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper.DefaultAutoExpireTime
member.summary: By default, files older than 1 hour is cleared

member.name: F:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper.DefaultMaxFilesInDirectory
member.summary: By default, if more than 1000 files exists in directory, they are deleted

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper.PurgeDirectoryDefault(System.String)
member.summary: Clears a folder based on default conditions
member.remarks: If any errors occur during cleanup, this doesn't raise an exception and ignored. Other errors might raise an exception. As errors are ignored, method can't gurantee that less than specified number of files will be in the folder after it ends.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.TemporaryFileHelper.PurgeDirectory(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Clears a folder based on specified conditions
member.param: Files with creation time older than this is deleted. If passed as 0, time based cleanup is skipped.
If more than this number of files exists, files will be deleted starting from oldest to newest. By passing 0, all files can be deleted. If passed as -1, file count based cleanup is skipped.
Safety file to be checked. If it is specified and it doesn't exists, operation is aborted.
member.remarks: If any errors occur during cleanup, this doesn't raise an exception and ignored. Other errors might raise an exception. As errors are ignored, method can't gurantee that less than specified number of files will be in the folder after it ends.

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.InitializedLocalText
member.summary: A subclass of LocalText class that contains a initial translation value. Some classes like NestedLocalTextRegistration uses this type to avoid re-registering a initialized local text object, when their Initialization method called more than once.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.FallbackLocalTextRegistry.BreakUpString(System.String)
member.summary: Break up string without spaces (e.g. LastDirectoryUpdate) into a normal string (e.g. 'Last Directory Update')

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.NestedPermissionKeyRegistration
member.summary: Contains helper methods for registration of permission keys in nested static classes. These classes contains string contants containing permission keys. Display name for permission keys can be set by [DisplayName] attribute. Display name for groups can be set by [Description] attribute on classes themselves. For group display name to work, all constants in a class must start with same group prefix.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.NestedPermissionKeyRegistration.AddNestedPermissions(Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalTextRegistry,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.Assembly})
member.summary: Gets permission keys and adds texts if any from static nested permission key classes marked with NestedPermissionKeys attribute.

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.ILocalTextContext
member.summary: Local text context abstraction for sites that support a pending approval mode.

member.name: P:Serenity.Localization.ILocalTextContext.IsApprovalMode
member.summary: Returns true if site is in pending approval mode for current user (e.g. a moderator)

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry
member.summary: Default ILocalTextRegistry implementation.
member.remarks: This implementation also supports a "pending approval" mode. If your site needs some moderator approval before translations are published, you may put your site to this mode when some moderator is using the site by registering an ILocalTextContext provider. Thus, moderators can see unapproved texts while they are logged in to the site.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.Add(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a local text entry to the registry

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.AddPending(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a pending approval local text entry to the registry. These texts can only be seen while moderators are browsing the site. You can determine which users are moderators by implementing ILocalTextContext interface, and registering it through the service locator.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.TryGet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns localized representation which corresponds to the local text key or the key itself if none found in local text registry.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.TryGet(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the local text key to its representation in requested language. Looks up text in requested language, its Fallbacks and invariant language in order. If not found in any, null is returned. See SetLanguageFallback for information about language fallbacks.
member.param: If pending approval texts to be used, true.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.SetLanguageFallback(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the language fallback of the specified language. When a text is not found in one language, LocalTextRegistry checks its language fallback for a translation. Some implicit language fallback definitions exist even if none set. For example, "en" is language fallback ID of "en-US" and "en-UK", "tr" is language fallback ID of "tr-TR". Also, invariant language ID ("") is an implicit fallback of all languages.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.GetAllAvailableTextsInLanguage(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all available text keys (that has a translation in language or any of its language fallbacks) and their local texts.
member.param: True if pending texts should be returned (e.g. in preview/edit mode).
member.returns: A dictionary of all texts in the language.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.LocalTextRegistry.GetAllTextKeys(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all text keys that is currently registered in any language

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.EnumLocalTextRegistration
member.summary: Contains initialization method for adding local text translations defined by Description attributes in enumeration classes.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.EnumLocalTextRegistration.Initialize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.Assembly},System.String,Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalTextRegistry)
member.summary: Adds local text translations defined implicitly by Description attributes in enumeration classes. Only enum values that has Description attribute are added as local text. By default, enums are registered in format: "Enums.{EnumerationTypeFullName}.{EnumValueName}". EnumerationTypeFullName, is fullname of the enumeration type. This can be overridden by attaching a EnumKey attribute.
member.param: Assemblies to search for enumeration classes in
Language ID texts will be added (default is invariant language)

member.name: T:Serenity.Localization.NestedLocalTextRegistration
member.summary: Contains helper methods for registration of local texts in nested static classes. Nested static contains LocalText objects with actual translations as keys. This class locates them (with NestedLocalTextsAttribute at outermost class), determines keys by path from outermost to nested class name, replaces existing LocalText instance with a InitializedLocalText instance containing this generated key and initial translation, and registers this translation in ILocalTextRegistry provider.

member.name: M:Serenity.Localization.NestedLocalTextRegistration.Initialize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.Assembly},Serenity.Abstractions.ILocalTextRegistry)
member.summary: Adds translations from static nested local text classes marked with NestedLocalTextAttribute.

member.name: T:Serenity.TwoLevelCache
member.summary: Contains helper functions to use local and distributed cache in sync with optional cache invalidation.

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCache.Get``1(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there, tries the distributed cache. If neither contains the specified key, produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local and distributed cache for a given expiration time. By using a group key, all items on both cache types that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache
Distributed cache expiration (is usually same with local expiration)

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCache.Get``1(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there, tries the distributed cache. If neither contains the specified key, produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local and distributed cache for a given expiration time. By using a group key, all items on both cache types that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCache.GetWithCustomSerializer``2(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Func{``1,``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there, tries the distributed cache. If neither contains the specified key, produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local and distributed cache for a given expiration time. By using a group key, all items on both cache types that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache
Distributed cache expiration (is usually same with local expiration)

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.
A function used to serialize items before cached.
A function used to deserialize items before cached.

member.name: M:Serenity.TwoLevelCache.GetLocalStoreOnly``1(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Tries to read a value from local cache. If it is not found there produces value by calling a loader function and adds the value to local cache for a given expiration time. By using a generation (item version) key, all items on local cache that are members of this group can be expired at once.
member.remarks: The difference between this and Get method is that this one only caches items in local cache, but uses distributed cache for versioning. To not check group generation every time an item is requested, generation number itself is also cached in local cache. Thus, when a generation number changes, local cached items might expire after about 5 seconds. This means that, if you use this strategy in a web farm setup, when a change occurs in one server, other servers might continue to use old local cached data for 5 seconds more. If this is a problem for your configuration, use DistributedCache directly.
member.param: The item key for local and distributed cache

Group key that will hold generation (version). Can be used to expire all items that depend on it. This can be a table name. When a table changes, you change its version, and all cached data that depends on that table is expired.
The delegate that will be called to generate value, if not found in local cache, or distributed cache, or all found items are expired.

member.summary: Converts object to its JSON representation

member.name: M:Serenity.JSON.ToJson(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object to its JSON representation (extension method for Stringify)
member.returns: JSON representation string.
member.remarks: null, Int32, Boolean, DateTime, Decimal, Double, Guid types handled automatically. If object has a ToJson method it is used, otherwise value.ToString() is used as last fallback.

member.name: M:Serenity.Invariants.TryParseID(System.String)

summary.p: Tries to converts an ID's string representation to its numerical ID value (Int64).
Unlike , null, empty string and all other invalid strings results in value (not an exception).

member.returns: Numerical ID value or Null.Int64 if null, empty, or invalid string.

summary.p: Tries to converts an ID's string representation to its numerical ID value (Int64).
Unlike , null, empty string and all other invalid strings results in value (not an exception).

member.returns: Numerical ID value or Null.Int64 if null, empty, or invalid string.

member.summary: Invariant language ID is an empty string

member.name: F:Serenity.LocalText.Empty
member.summary: An empty local text instance like String.Empty

member.summary: Creates a new LocalText instance that contains the specified local text key

member.name: P:Serenity.LocalText.Key
member.summary: Gets the local text key

member.name: M:Serenity.LocalText.ToString
member.summary: Returns localized representation which corresponds to the local text key or the key itself if none found in local text registry.

member.name: M:Serenity.LocalText.op_Implicit(Serenity.LocalText)~System.String
member.summary: Implicit conversion to String that returns localized representation which corresponds to the local text key or the key itself if none found in local text registry.

member.name: M:Serenity.LocalText.op_Implicit(System.String)~Serenity.LocalText

member.name: M:Serenity.LocalText.TryGet(System.String)

member.name: T:Serenity.StringHelper
member.summary: This static class contains some helper functions that operate on objects.

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsEmptyOrNull(System.String)

summary.p: Returns true if is null or empty (zero length)

remarks.p: This function might be useful if an empty string is assumed to be null.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsNullOrEmpty().

member.returns: If is null or empty, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsNullOrEmpty(System.String)

summary.p: Returns true if is null or empty (zero length)

remarks.p: This function might be useful if an empty string is assumed to be null.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsNullOrEmpty().

member.returns: If is null or empty, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsTrimmedEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a string is null, empty or just contains whitespace characters.

remarks.p: Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsTrimmedEmpty().

member.returns: If string is null, empty or contains only white space, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.TrimToNull(System.String)

summary.p: Removes whitespace characters in the left or right of the string, and if resulting string is empty or null, returns null.

remarks.p: Generally, when a user entered string is going to be saved to database, if user entered an empty string, null or a string of whitespaces, it is stored as null, otherwise it is expected to remove whitespace at start and end only.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.TrimToNull().

member.returns: Trimmed string, result is null if empty.

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.TrimToEmpty(System.String)

summary.p: Removes whitespace characters in the left or right of the string, and if resulting string is empty or null, returns empty.

remarks.p: Generally, when a user entered string is going to be saved to database, if user entered an empty string, null or a string of whitespaces, it is stored as empty string, otherwise it is expected to remove whitespace at start and end only.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.TrimToEmpty().

member.returns: Trimmed string (result won't be null).

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.IsTrimmedSame(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two strings ignoring whitespace at the left or right.

remarks.p: null is considered to be empty.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This function can be used to compare a string entered by user to the value in the database for equality.

member.returns: If two strings are same trimmed, true

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.ThreeDots(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: If the string's length is over a specified limit, trims its right and adds three points ("...").
member.remarks: This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.ThreeDots().
member.param: Maksimum length for the resulting string. If given as 0, or is shorter than this value, string returns as is. Otherwise it is trimmed to be under this limit in length including "the three dots".
member.returns: itself, or trimmed and three dotted string

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.QuoteString(System.String,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Quotes a string

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.ToStringDefault``1(System.Nullable{``0},System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.String)
member.summary: Formats a nullable struct
member.param: The format string If null use the default format defined for the type of the IFormattable implementation.
The format provider If null the default provider is used
The string to show when the source is null. If null an empty string is returned
member.returns: The formatted string or the default value if the source is null

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.ToStringDefault``1(``0,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.String)
member.summary: Formats a nullable object
member.param: The format string If null use the default format defined for the type of the IFormattable implementation.
The format provider If null the default provider is used
The string to show when the source is null. If null an empty string is returned
member.returns: The formatted string or the default value if the source is null

member.name: M:Serenity.StringHelper.Join(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Joins two strings conditionally, by putting separator between if both are non empty

member.name: T:Munq.IocContainer
member.summary: The implementation of the IOC container. Implements the IDependencyRegistrar and IDependencyResolver, along with the IContainerFluent and IDisposable interfaces. The container is thread safe.

member.name: M:Munq.IocContainer.#ctor
M:Munq.IocContainer.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: Disposes of all Container scoped (ContainerLifetime) instances cached in the type registry, and disposes of the type registry itself.

member.name: M:Munq.IocContainer.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Implements the Disposed(boolean disposing) method of Disposable pattern.

member.name: M:Munq.IocContainer.Finalize
member.summary: The finalizer just ensures the container is disposed.

member.name: T:Munq.CreateInstanceDelegateFactory
member.summary: This class provides a method to build a delegate to create a specified type. It is used by Register<TType, TImp>() to build the Func<IDependencyResolver, TImp> need to create the instance to be returned. Also used by the Resolve methods if the type requested is a class, not an interface, and is not currently Registered in the container.

member.name: M:Munq.CreateInstanceDelegateFactory.Create(System.Type)
member.summary: Build a delegate to return an instance of the specified type given an instance of IocContainer. Finds the public constructor with the most parameters. The resulting method calls the container to resolve each parameter in the constructor.
member.returns: The delegate to create an instance of the class.

member.name: T:Munq.ILifetimeManager
member.summary: Defines the functionality for Lifetime Managers. Implementation should instantiate an instance store and use the Registration's Key property to index the data in the store. This allows one lifetime manager to service multiple Registrations.

member.name: M:Munq.ILifetimeManager.GetInstance(Munq.IRegistration)
member.summary: Get an instance for the registration, using the lifetime manager to cache instance as required by the scope of the lifetime manager.
member.param: The registration which is used to supply the storage key and create a new instance if required.
member.returns: The cached or new instance.

member.name: M:Munq.ILifetimeManager.InvalidateInstanceCache(Munq.IRegistration)
member.summary: Invalidate the instance in whatever storage is used by the lifetime manager.
member.param: The registration which is used to supply the storage key and create a new instance if required.

member.name: T:Munq.IRegistration
member.summary: This is the result of registering a type in the container.

member.name: P:Munq.IRegistration.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the registration.

member.name: P:Munq.IRegistration.Key
member.summary: Gets the key that is used to identify cached values.

member.name: P:Munq.IRegistration.ResolvesTo
member.summary: Gets the type the contain will Resolve to when this Registration is used.

member.name: M:Munq.IRegistration.WithLifetimeManager(Munq.ILifetimeManager)
member.summary: Sets the lifetime manager to be used by this Registration.
member.returns: 'this', or the Registration.

member.name: M:Munq.IRegistration.InvalidateInstanceCache
member.summary: Invalidates any cached value so that a new instance will be created on the next Resolve call.

member.name: M:Munq.IRegistration.CreateInstance
member.summary: Creates an instance of the type using the registered function.
member.returns: The new instance.

member.name: T:Munq.IRegistrationKey
member.summary: This interface is used internally to identify registrations in the type registry.

member.name: M:Munq.IRegistrationKey.GetInstanceType
member.summary: Gets the type that this key identifies.
member.returns: Returns the type of the registration.
